#Text=Taipei plane crash toll reaches 40
#Text=Saturday , February 7 , 2015
#Text=Emergency services on-scene in the immediate aftermath .
#Text=Image : M940504 .
#Text=The death toll from Wednesday 's plane crash in Taipei , Taiwan reached 40 today with the recovery of five more bodies .
#Text=There were 58 on board when TransAsia Airways Flight 235 crashed into the city 's Keelung River .
#Text=Fifteen survived and three more remain missing .
#Text=Tzu Chi Foundation volunteer Lee Hung Shu-ying said today cold weather meant the families of the missing believe their loved ones are dead .
#Text=The Aviation Safety Council is investigating .
#Text=The plane was in the air for minutes before banking steeply , hitting an elevated road , and crashing into the river .
#Text=The domestic flight from Taipei Songshan Airport was headed to the island of Kinmen .
#Text=Investigators are focusing on the ATR 72-600 's engines .
#Text=One engine automatically ' feathered ' itself .
#Text=Feathering involves the turboprop 's propeller rotating its blades to reduce drag .
#Text=Engines autofeather when they fail ( ' flaming out ' ) .
#Text=By reducing drag on the non-working engine , a twin turboprop plane can fly safely using only its other engine .
#Text=A feathered engine will not provide any thrust .
#Text=The reason for autofeathering is presently unclear ; what is known is the flight crew subsequently shut off the wrong engine .
#Text=A series of stall warnings went off in the cockpit as the aircraft headed to disaster .

#Text=Aviation Safety Council managing director Thomas Wang confirmed an automated " number two engine flameout " message should have alerted the crew to the engine trouble , leading them to follow " the corresponding checklist " .

column1: #Text=" There are procedures that pilots go through — safeguards — when you 're going to shut down an engine , particularly close to the ground , " said John M. Cox , former commercial pilot and boss of a safety consultant .
#Text=" Why that did n't occur here , I do n't know . "
#Text=The crashed aircraft at Taipei Songshan Airport early last month .
#Text=Image : 玄史生 .
#Text=Stephen Fredrick , a former pilot of similar aircraft , told CNN video showing the final seconds is consistent with dual flameout .
#Text=He said the wings-level , nose-down position suggested gliding .
#Text=Wang , however , cautions it is too early to blame any particular factor .
#Text=" At this moment we just release the numbers , the parameter we 've confirmed , we did not release any judgment who did what at this time " .
#Text=The Aviation Safety Council has teamed up with engine manufacturer Pratt & Whitney Canada to examine the engines .
#Text=Also being prioritised is finalising a cockpit voice recorder transcript and cockpit examination .
#Text=The aircraft was near-new .
#Text=Local prosecutors are investigating potential " professional error " , and the Civil Aeronautics Administration has ordered TransAsia retest all ATR pilots .

column1: #Text=90 flights over three days are cancelled to allow the proficiency checks .
#Text=TransAsia and Uni Air have also been ordered to check their collective 22 ATRs for engine and fuel system problems .

#Text=Pilot Liao Chien-tsung and his co-pilot , not publicly identified , were initially hailed as heroes by prosecutors , mayor Ko Wen-je , international press , and at least one relative of a survivor .
#Text=After declaring " Mayday Mayday , engine flameout " to air traffic control the pair grappled with their struggling plane , avoiding buildings in its path .
#Text=They have been credited with reducing the death toll .
#Text=Their bodies were found in the cockpit , with leg fractures .
#Text=Both were still holding the wrecked plane 's controls .
